content.raw:
To my novice eyes, this looks pretty reasonable to me.  I was able to launch the simulation with this in place, and interact with the model in some reasonable ways.  I do have a few questions:

* How much force will have to be applied to depress the button?  There is a spring stiffness, but I don't know how that translates to force to depress.  Is this something we have to document?
* Technically, it looks like the "tool" link is 2kg, and the "button" link is 0.1 kg, so the mass of the whole thing is 2.1 kg.  Is that how it works in simulation?  Are we aiming for exactly 2kg, or is the extra bit OK?
* Is this object far enough away/too far from the radio on the table?  Are there certain parameters we are looking to hit there?

To my novice eyes, this looks pretty reasonable to me. I was able to launch the simulation with this in place, and interact with the model in some reasonable ways. I do have a few questions:

  • How much force will have to be applied to depress the button? There is a spring stiffness, but I don't know how that translates to force to depress. Is this something we have to document?
  • Technically, it looks like the "tool" link is 2kg, and the "button" link is 0.1 kg, so the mass of the whole thing is 2.1 kg. Is that how it works in simulation? Are we aiming for exactly 2kg, or is the extra bit OK?
  • Is this object far enough away/too far from the radio on the table? Are there certain parameters we are looking to hit there?
